claim_content: A video shared in early 2024 showed Taylor Swift holding up a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."
article_content:
On Feb. 4, 2024, a user on X named il Donaldo Trumpo (@PapiTrumpo) – whose account mentions that it posts "a little bit of parody" – posted (archived) a video that appeared to show 14-time Grammy Award-winning recording artist Taylor Swift holding up a flag while walking the red carpet that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."
AWWW... THANK YOU!!!??? pic.twitter.com/hAGQG2BSBP
— il Donaldo Trumpo (@PapiTrumpo) February 5, 2024

While the video may have appeared obviously fake to some users, Elon Musk's social media platform X still showed a label that was displayed under the post that identified it as "manipulated media," adding a link to "find out more" and "stay informed."
The link in the "manipulated media" label led to a policy page on help.twitter.com, which showed that remnants of the old name "Twitter" could still be found on the platform. The page began, "You may not share synthetic, manipulated, or out-of-context media that may deceive or confuse people and lead to harm ('misleading media'). In addition, we may label posts containing misleading media to help people understand their authenticity and to provide additional context."
The original video posted by Variety on Feb. 4 showed Swift simply walking the red carpet and posing for photos, holding no flags or banners of any kind.
Taylor Swift is gorgeous at the #Grammys. https://t.co/Imoq8xlJM9 pic.twitter.com/ydotYDoXFI
— Variety (@Variety) February 5, 2024

As Snopes previously reported, Swift's past expressions of her political beliefs were somewhat the opposite of the idea of embracing false conspiracy theories about the 2020 U.S. presidential election. For example, she previously expressed views in opposition to the politics of former U.S. President Donald Trump and U.S. Sen. Marsha Blackburn of Tennessee – who are both Republicans – in the 2020 documentary "Miss Americana" and on her Instagram account.

original_rationals.rationale1: While the video may have appeared obviously fake to some users, Elon Musk's social media platform X still showed a label that was displayed under the post that identified it as "manipulated media," adding a link to "find out more" and "stay informed."
original_rationals.rationale2: The link in the "manipulated media" label led to a policy page on help.twitter.com, which showed that remnants of the old name "Twitter" could still be found on the platform. The page began, "You may not share synthetic, manipulated, or out-of-context media that may deceive or confuse people and lead to harm ('misleading media'). In addition, we may label posts containing misleading media to help people understand their authenticity and to provide additional context."
original_rationals.rationale3: The original video posted by Variety on Feb. 4 showed Swift simply walking the red carpet and posing for photos, holding no flags or banners of any kind.

summary_rationals.synthesized_rationale: The claim that Taylor Swift held up a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards stating 'Trump Won, Democrats Cheated' has been rated as 'Fake' due to several key reasons. The video in question was flagged as 'manipulated media' on Elon Musk's social media platform X, leading users to a policy page that emphasizes the prohibition of sharing deceptive content. Additionally, the original video shared by a credible source like Variety showed no such flag. Taylor Swift's documented political stance against figures like Donald Trump further contradicts the claim, implying that it is highly unlikely for her to support such conspiracy theories. These factors together suggest that the claim lacks authenticity and is likely fabricated, leading to its 'Fake' rating.

relationship_with_evidence.relationship_with_evidence0: The evidence provided in the form of a tweet shared by user il Donaldo Trumpo (@PapiTrumpo) on X, showing a video of Taylor Swift holding a flag with the words 'Trump Won, Democrats Cheated,' is refuted by the rationale for the claim rating. The rationale explains that despite the appearance of the video, Elon Musk's platform X identified it as 'manipulated media,' leading to a policy page warning against sharing deceptive content. Moreover, a reliable source like Variety shared the original video showing Swift without any flags. Additionally, Swift's known political views opposing figures like Donald Trump further discredit the claim, indicating that it is improbable she would endorse such conspiracy theories. Therefore, the evidence of the video contradicts the rationale-based assessment that the claim is 'Fake,' suggesting it lacks credibility and authenticity.

relationship_with_evidence.relationship_with_evidence: The rationale provided for rating the claim 'Fake,' regarding Taylor Swift holding up a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards stating 'Trump Won, Democrats Cheated,' is strongly supported by the evidence from Variety's original video shared on February 4, 2024. The fact that the original video, a credible source, showed Swift merely walking the red carpet with no flags or banners contradicts the claim. This evidence aligns with the rationale highlighting the lack of authenticity in the manipulated video. Furthermore, considering Swift's documented political stance against individuals like Donald Trump as previously expressed in the documentary 'Miss Americana' and her social media, it is evident that the claim of her supporting conspiracy theories is unfounded, reinforcing the 'Fake' rating.
